meanings.definition: To prevent from saving or conserving.
meanings.sent1: She always forgets to turn off the lights, which can dissaver energy.
meanings.sent2: Not buying in bulk can dissaver money in the long run.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful wizard accidentally cast a spell to dissaver all the food in the kingdom.
meanings.sent4: His careless actions were a constant dissaver of resources.
meanings.sent5: The leaky faucet was a silent dissaver of water, dripping away unnoticed.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that hinders saving or conserving.
meanings.sent1: The impulsive shopper was a known dissaver of funds.
meanings.sent2: The broken fridge became a dissaver of perishable goods.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was a little dissaver, stealing nuts from the pantry.
meanings.sent4: Her old car was a dissaver of fuel, guzzling gas like there was no tomorrow.
meanings.sent5: The forgetful employee was a dissaver of time, always causing delays with his mistakes.
